news_header: Berlin kebab prices rise, but security concerns and US politics dominate discussions among locals.
news_original_title: Kebabista on tullut Saksan talouden mittari ja jopa vaalien ratkaisija – näin vaaleja kommentoidaan döner-kioskilla
news_text: In Berlin, kebab prices have surged, now averaging 7.50 euros, reflecting broader economic concerns. Locals express anxiety over European security and the impact of US politics under Trump. While some believe Europe can manage without US support, others emphasize the importance of maintaining strong transatlantic ties. Immigration remains a contentious issue, with fears of rising extremism. First-time voter Alina Galita highlights the need for integration, wanting her family to feel part of German society. Overall, the kebab kiosk has become a microcosm of larger societal issues, blending economic worries with political and social sentiments.
